title: Irish mother who escaped Sudan fighting with her children 'heartbroken' as husband left behind
description: An Irish woman has described her dramatic escape from Sudan with her children as gunfire erupted around them - and has been left "heartbroken" as her husband remains in the country.

title: Joe Biden says 'yes' to re-election bid
description: He's been asked so many times if he'll run for president again; whether he'll seek that second term.

title: 'World's largest cross-border power line' to be built by UK and Netherlands
description: A new power line which could provide green electricity to 1.8 million homes is set to be built by the UK and the Netherlands as part of a plan to boost energy security.

title: UK troops fly to Sudan as government works on evacuation plan for Britons
description: A team of British troops has flown to a port in eastern Sudan on a reconnaissance mission as the UK works out options to help evacuate British nationals stranded in the crisis-hit country, Sky News understands.

title: At least 60 killed 'by men wearing army uniforms' in Burkina Faso
description: At least 60 civilians have been killed by men wearing army uniforms in northern Burkina Faso, officials say.

title: Spain braced for record-breaking April temperatures of 40C
description: Spain could experience its hottest ever day for the month of April this week with forecasters predicting temperatures of up to 40C (104F).

title: Most detailed images of Mars' moon Deimos unveiled
description: The most detailed images of Mars' moon Deimos have been unveiled after a probe flew just 100km (62 miles) from its surface.

title: What the Jedi master of the dark arts of diplomacy wants from chairing the UN Security Council
description: If diplomacy is the "patriotic art of lying for one's country" then few do it better than Sergei Lavrov.

title: Climate protesters attempt to bring Berlin traffic to a halt - as protests continue in London
description: German climate activists have glued themselves to streets all over Berlin this morning in a bid to bring traffic to a standstill.

title: Pictures: Northern Lights illuminate UK skies
description: The bright Northern Lights illuminated the sky across certain parts of the UK last night.

title: New theories emerge over possible links between COVID vaccines and tinnitus
description: There could be possible links between the COVID-19 vaccine and tinnitus, according to research.

title: Some 4,000 British passport holders in Sudan - amid warnings UK govt 'severely limited' in ability to help them
description: There are understood to be around 4,000 British passport holders in Sudan after foreign secretary James Cleverly warned the UK government is "severely limited" in its ability to help British nationals until the conflict ends.

title: Sikh separatist leader arrested by Indian police after weeks on the run
description: Separatist leader Amritpal Singh has been arrested by Indian police after weeks on the run.

title: Which countries have evacuated their citizens from Sudan?
description: As foreign countries evacuate hundreds of their citizens from the escalating violence in Sudan, the UK government has been accused of not doing enough to extract its own nationals.
